metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6796 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A content process could have modified shared memory relating to crashreporting information, crash itself, and cause an out-of-bound write. Thiscould have caused memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 73 and Firefox < ESR68.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
